item.title: [Paper] End-to-End OCR
item.description: Towards Unconstrained End-to-End Text Spotting â­ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸â­ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸â­ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸â­ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸ï¸ | arXiv This paper is motivated by a simple observation; most OCR engine proceed in two steps: Train a detector to identify the text boxe Crop on this box and use a traditional OCR engine Their intent is thus to provide an end-to-end network to replace both components. This proves especially useful for text of irregular shape, curved text for instance.
